conclusion: The problem involves analyzing how shadows (A, B, C, and D) change when the light source moves forward above the objects, considering both position and size.
The objects are a pie (casting shadow A), a carton (casting shadow C), a calendar (casting shadow B), and a baseball (casting shadow D). The shadows are cast on the ground.
Shadows are influenced by the position of the light source relative to the objects and the ground.
When the light source moves forward, the direction of the light changes, altering the angle at which the light hits the objects and causing the shadows to shift position and potentially change size.
As the light source moves forward, the shadows will move backward relative to the objects because the light rays now hit the objects from a more forward angle.

The size of the shadows depends on the distance between the light source and the objects. If the light source moves closer to the objects while moving forward, the shadows will become larger due to diverging light rays. If the light source moves farther away while moving forward, the shadows will become smaller due to converging light rays.
The pie (shadow A) is relatively flat, so its shadow will remain compact but shift backward. Its size may increase slightly depending on the proximity of the light source.
The calendar (shadow B) is upright and has a rectangular shape. Its shadow will shift backward and may elongate slightly due to its vertical structure.
The carton (shadow C) is tall and angular. Its shadow will shift backward and may stretch or distort depending on the angle of the light.
The baseball (shadow D) is spherical, so its shadow will remain circular but shift backward. Its size may increase slightly if the light source moves closer.
When the light source moves forward above the objects, all shadows (A, B, C, and D) will shift backward relative to their respective objects.
If the light source moves closer to the objects, the shadows will become larger. If the light source moves farther away, the shadows will become smaller.
